title: How to Blow a Bubble with Your Hands

steps.headline: Enter your usual hand washing area.
Wet your hands under the sink, not too wet or the bubbles will be too thin.
Put soap on your hands, liquid soap usually works better than bars.
Rub hands in a hand cleaning fashion.
Put your hand in the "OK" position and close your index finger into your thumb, so you're making a fist with just your thumb and index finger.

Re-open your finger into the "OK" position, there should be a thin layer of soap, looking like it does on a bubble wand, inside that space (be sure, when opening your fingers not to disconnect from the thumb or you will need to start all over).
Blow lightly through the space and watch as a bubble appears (usually it will pop before is disconnects from your hand, but with some practice it will float for about two seconds, then...
steps.description: pop!). After 1-3 uses you may want to put more soap on your hand and rinse it a tiny bit.

Rub hands in a hand cleaning fashion.  Put your hand in the "OK" position and close your index finger into your thumb, so you're making a fist with just your thumb and index finger.  Re-open your finger into the "OK" position, there should be a thin layer of soap, looking like it does on a bubble wand, inside that space (be sure, when opening your fingers not to disconnect from the thumb or you will need to start all over).  Blow lightly through the space and watch as a bubble appears (usually it will pop before is disconnects from your hand, but with some practice it will float for about two seconds, then... pop!). After 1-3 uses you may want to put more soap on your hand and rinse it a tiny bit.
